intro: Dodecatheon serratum, commonly known as the sawleaf glory-of-the-snow, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with serrated leaves that give it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded woodlands and is often found in rich, loamy soils. Dodecatheon serratum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a food source for pollinators.
